comments:
I get the following NPE when trying to start this build

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2005-03-02 19:55:09.432
!MESSAGE The scheme cannot be null
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException: The scheme cannot be null
	at org.eclipse.jface.bindings.Binding.<init>(Binding.java:190)

org.eclipse.ui.internal.keys.BindingPersistence.readBindingsFromPreferences(BindingPersistence.java:936)

I get the same exception, and Eclipse exits after that. If I create a new
workspace this doesn't happen. If I use my development workspace, then I cannot
successfully start it. Any known workraround ?

Workaround is to go to Window > Preferences > General > Keys and press the
'Restore  Defaults' button.
Jeromne, how do you apply the workaround on a workspace that doesn't start ?

I started the workspace with the previous build (I20050222), applied the
workaround, then started the same workspace with I20050301.

There is a missing "continue;" when this error condition is detected.

Could you please attach your workbench preferences as they look when the error
is occurring?

Sorry, I already applied the workaround, so I've lost my preferences as they
looked when the error occured.

Created an attachment (id=18485)
Dirk's Preferences

Here is the relevent bit of the preferences file, and formatted so that it it
easier to read.

I believe that it is safe to ignore the case where the keyConfigurationId is
null.  But I just want to make sure.  Dirk, does this look like what your
custom key bindings are intended to be?

Alt+`	      Next Editor
Alt+Shift+3   Next Editor (it's actually Alt+§)
Ctrl+=	      Toggle Folding
Ctrk+K	      Open Editor
Ctrl+`	      Next Perspective
Ctrl+Shift+3  Next Perspective (it's actually Ctrl+§)
Shift+Space   Correction Assist
Alt+Shift+C   Modify Method Parameters
Alt+Shift+P   Show Package Explorer
Alt+Shift+X   Show Problems View

There are two bindings I don't understand.  Is it safe to ignore these?  Do
these mean anything to you?


	<keyBinding
		contextId\="org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window"
		keySequence\="CTRL+1"
		locale\=""
		platform\=""/>
	<keyBinding
		contextId\="org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window" 
	       
commandId\="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.edit.text.java.correction.assist.proposals" 
		keySequence\="SHIFT+SPACE"
		locale\=""
		platform\=""/>

As far as I remember my custom keybindings are:

Alt+`	      Next Editor
Ctrl+`	      Next Perspective
Shift+Space   Correction Assist

Yes, the Shift+Space key binding does mean anything to me. I use this to trigger
Quick+Fix which is handy together with Ctrl+Space for code assist.

I've add the missing continue.  I'm going to close this bug as fixed.  If you
have any further problems, either re-open this bug or file a new bug.
Having difficulty verifying due to bug 89623.

Stefan, you can go to the keys preference page to view changes to the key
bindings as a method to verify.

Verified by pasting Dirk's commands preference into my own preference.  This now
only generates a warning.
